I will take examples from a corperation I am a part of in Eve Online a space sandbox MMORPG.
Usually the players in that corperation form a group a players. We all are in the same corp. We got a discord , but do different things, most of us live in wormhole space, but some are also in Empire space.
We do stuff mostly on our own. Everybody just wants to enjoy playing the game. So while we can get grouped together, by all beeing in the same corp, we don't work together like a team most the time.
However, we got sheduled fleets(like Raids) were we take on Sleeper NPCs and kill the Drifter NPC boss. These fleets pay well, but mostly require multible people. A group can't easily take those NPCs out. You need a team for that. We got a Golem that tanks the NPCs most of the time, so that Paladins and Leshaks can deal more Damage. Guardians are there to heal the fleet. Everybody got a role, Even though who gets what role can change, everybody knows what to do and everybody trusts the other people to do their part of the job. At the end of the day everyone works together to get the good loot from those NPCs.
So a group of people is just multible similar people that are together. A Team is a group, where everyone works together to achieve something, a single person could not have done.

People in a group are less cohesive and lack a common goal.

The team has a high level of cohesion. They work together towards a common goal.

For example : 

cybersport team and group of people on the street.

An cybersport team has common goals(win the tournament) and a high level of team play. Everyone contributes.

A group of people on the street may not know each other at all. In addition, each of them goes his own way and is busy with himself.

A group is a collection of people who are somewhat together and thus share a basic relationship with each other. A team on the hand, shares a common goal and works together to actually achieve it. This obviously requires a connection and communication between the team members. In general, in a group of people, everyone kinda works on their own, while in a team, everyone, at least tries to work together.

A group is a (more or less arbitrary) collection of people not necessarily related to one another and not necessarily working together or sharing a common goal.
A team is a group of people working together towards a common goal.

For example, the collection of all students attaining a lecture are just a group, as they might not even really know each other.
"Homework groups" of students working together on homework are teams, however, as they work together, by for example dividing tasks among team members, to solve homework problems (i.e., a common goal)

group:
participants just happen to be there
as they are not yet acquainted with one another they are uncoordinated and take longer to do anything

team:
them being together actually has a purpose (e.g. pursuing a common goal)
they work effectively together because they know each other and therefore are better at allocating tasks

Explain the differences between groups and teams.
1.A group is only a number of people that have relatiobship to one another, but a team is a group of people involved in the same activity with a common goal.
2. The participants of a group are loosely connected, but a team's participants are strongly connected.
3.A group does not focus on specific outcomes or a common purpose, but a team does. A team requires coordination of tasks and activities.
4.Every individual of a group works on his own, but team members need to work together.

Point out the differences using two examples in your own words.
Group: All of my professors can be a group. They are colleagues, but are professional in different fields. They teach students different subjects separately.
Team: Football team of Bayern Munich. All of team members need to work together and they have the same goal—score and win! They train together and trust each other.

In a team everybody work for the other teammate. In a group everybody do his stuff, but not help other group members directly.

In a team you have a aim, everybody want to reach together. In a group everybody try to reach this aim on his own.

A group is a collection of people who have at least a loose conection to one another. They don't necessarily share the same goals and they often don't work together to get their desired outcome. A group could consist of complete strangers who will never get to know each other. People waiting on a bus station can be called a group. Their loose connection would be, that they all want to take the bus, but odds are they don't want to get to the same location and they won't work together to get there. A team on the other hand is a group where every member also shares the same goals and where all the members deliberatly choose to work together to get the desired outcome. A perfect example of that would be a soccer team. The entire team will work together to win as many soccer games as they possibly can to ensure the best position in the overall turnament.

A group of people are loosely connected induvial with no specific focus, goals or common purpose (as a group). 
Example: Participates of Ted Talks. 

A team of people have a need to work together to achieve a specific task, activity, and or goal. 
Example: Military extraction team

A group is a number of people that have little in common. Each one works on his own and they do not share any common goals. Simply put, they're barely related. A group of people could, for example, be students in a classroom taking an individual exam. Eah person must work on his own.
On the other hand, a team is composed of strongly connected people. They work together towards a common goal, and are usually involved in the same activity, such as a sport or work. By sharing the same objectives, they need to coordinate and work together. A football team, for example, needs to coordinate and use a specific formation and strategy, in order to reach a common goal: winning the game.

In a group several people got a relationship among each other, but they don't have to be involved in the same activity. Whereas in a team they got the same activity and a common goal. Thus in a group participants are loosely connected and in teams strongly. Additionally members have to work together and require coordination.

An example for a team is a football team. Here 11 players got the common goal to win the game, while scoring goals and stopping they enemy from doing so. They are also coordinated by representing different roles within the team.

An example for a group are students in a classroom. They spend their day together and all listen to their teacher, but they are not coordinating among each other and succeed or fail on their own.

Group is a number of people that have some relationship to one another. In a group, participants are loosely connected. They do not focus on specific outcomes or a common purpose, while every individual works on his own.
Team is any group of people involved in the same activity with a common goal, especially referring to sports and work. In a team, participants are strongly connected. They focus on a specific outcome, requires coordination of tasks and activities. And members need to work together.

For example, in a start-up company, severals staffs are one group. Participants have to work on their own in different fields for the company. They do not need to work together for a special common goal. Here in the EIST course, we would build and join a software engineering team, this is a team because we should work together to finish our team work. We have the same goal that we all want to practice well the knowledge we learned, and in the end achieve good notes. A team is just like this: Together Everyone Achieves More.

Groups are an unspecified amount of people with a certain degree of connection, where every individual is on his own, whereas teams have a shared goal and work together to achieve a specific outcome. In a team communication and collaboration is necessary. Thus, a team could be considered as a group with a common purpose.
For example in a shared house, the neighbors of this house would form a group that is connected through living in the same building, but do not have the same goals. They would not be a team. In gymnastics the "Final Five" would be a team as they won the team event at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro only through a collective effort.

The main difference between a team and a group is that the members of a group do not work together and having a certain goal in mind. Because that is the case for a team, a team is connected stronger focusing on what they are aiming for. A group is in that sense only loosely connected. Also a group does not work together but every member is working for her/his own. In a team all the members work together, as they are trying to accomplish something together. 
An example for a group is me and my friends when we meet to play table tennis. Everyone is playing for its own and we are not connected that much, since everyone of us could also play against other people without a great change considering the game play.
An example for a team is for example a professional CS:GO team. All five players and the coach are working together, to win against the other team. If everyone in the team would play for herself/himself in a selfish way, their goal to win the match would be impossible. Also in a CS:GO pro team you can see, that the members are strongly connected to each other. For Example if an enemy is spottet they are telling each other. Also the players know the strengths and weaknesses of the otherw well and try to compensate them.

A group is a number of people that have a certain relationship amongst the members. Groups don't have a specific goal, so the participants son't work together and have a loose connection to one another.

A team is a number of people working on the same activity with a common purpose. Participants therefore have to have a stronger connection to one another and work together. Teams have their focus on these specific outcomes, where they strive to achieve the best possible outcome.

For example, given a study group consisting 20-30 EIST-students: These students will have a loose connection, which is based on them all getting the lecture EIST. This group will lack a common goal, so the participants won't work together. But given a group of software developers in a firm, they will have a common objective and will have to work together, keep a tighter connection (e.g a Scrum meeting every 24 hours), and try to achieve the best possible outcome together. So this group of software developers can be pronounced a "Team".

While in a group there are people who have any relation to each other, in a team, there is a group of people who have the same goals as each other. Usually, in groups people do not have to work with each other, however, teams require the participants to work together. 

For example, when you get on a plane, the people here do not form a team when they may form a group. Since they do not have a common goal and they do not need to work together for this purpose, they can not form a team. 

But the cabin crew on this flight can form a team because everyone needs to work for this flight to go well. Pilot flies, steward/esses, cooks, etc. works in the service area and the flight is successfully provided with collaborative work. They form a team rather than a group, as they aim for a team, not an individual.

Exp.1 Esports (LoL)
In a Group of players, each individual just play for themselves looking for their own lead, where in a team, players have the same vision and plan to win, knowing when to sometimes play passively to avoid loss while others are making the winning play.

Exp.2 Football
In a group, people would just play according to what kind of position they are, doing only basic passes, where a team would be capable of executing plans such as offside traps or wasting time and enemy's energy with calculated passes.

Both require the Scrum that costs a lot of time, but ends up way more successfully than just a group.

Group: 
A group is a number of people that collectively work together with coordinated efforts. There is no specific goal. They are only loosely connected and in the end everyone is working on his own. A good example would be when people share a ski lift ride. In this particular moment they are a group. 

Team:
A team is a group with common goals that is involved in the same activity. A good example would be a football team that shares the will to win all the games in the season to become the league champion.

We will begin with what a group of people can be called. This term can be used to describe people that have a certain connection, which may a project that they are working on together. They do not intend to broaden their relationship with each other it is solely on the grounds of finishing something together. Furthermore they do not aim for a collective goal, which in turn makes working together very difficult. Each person is following their own goal. On the contrary a team, each member has a strong bond of trust and understanding, while working to a collective goal. They rely on each other and actively seek to work together. These are the fundamental differences between a group and a team working on a project.

The people in a group have some relationship to one another but do not have a common goal. The people in a team work together towards a common goal but do not necessarily need to have relationships between each other.
A group of friends have different jobs, different goals, even though they meet each other pretty frequently.
A football team may train hard to win a match on the weekend but the players do not necessarily hang out outside of the training sessions.

1) Group is a number of people who are in a some relationship with each other, so, for example tutor group. People don't focus on a specific purpose and everyone works individually.
2) Team is a group of persons, who do the same activity and focus on a common goal. For example teams in tutor groups, which work on a specific programming task and make a program for the grading bonus.

A team is a special type of group. While the bond between the people in a group isn't strong, people in a team are well connected. A team has a goal they want to reach together. For example, a soccer team wants to win a game. On top of that the members of a team need to communicate and work together to achieve their goal. For instance, the players in a soccer team each have slightly different tasks (defending, attacking) during a game. And every player is needed in order to score. Groups lack that type of shared goal and team work.

In a team, participants have a strong connection to working together in order to focus on achieving one common goal. Meanwhile, people in a group work individually, and each person focuses on different goals, therefore there is a weak connection between them.

Group 
1) Participants do not communicate with each other and work on their own as an individual.
2) Members do not share the same purpose and goal. 

Team
1)  Team members share the same purpose and work together to achieve their goals by communicating strongly.
2 ) Members need to share the amount of work between themselves and work collaboratively.

Example for Group) A group of students in a class, which all have different tasks and an project to present individually. 

Example for Team) 4 Students have an project homework, where they all have to work together about cultural differences and represent their findings to the class. Each student in the team are going to get the same grade according to the project they represent together.

The difference between the two is basically, a group consists of people that have a relationship to one another, they are loosely linked, are not focused on particular outcomes and everybody somehow works on their "corner". On the other hand a Team, is a group of people that have set goals, referring specifically to work and sports... the group of people are highly connected, have a specific outcome in mind with detailed  steps that have to be taken, most importantly team work, it plays a massive role in success!

Groups are loosely connected members with coordinated actions whereas teams have the same goal have to work together to achieve these goals. Group members work individually and their work is independent of their members. 

For example, a group may be students in the class who solve an exercise collectively but the end result is different for each student. A team maybe a few members working together in a web development team to develop an application, the end-results of their work must be consistent with each other and even build one each others work.

Both a group and a team are made up of at least 2 people. 
A group is loosely connected by a shared activity or interest and may or may not share a common goal. Additionally, every individual works on their own. In a team, the members are definitely associated with each other either due to their activity or work. They share the work and responsibility and work towards a common goal. 
For example, at a public viewing of a football game the people observing are just a group of fans. They might share some things such as that they are football fans and want their team to win or that they live in the same area. The fact they have something in common is enough to qualify them as a group. However, unlike the football team, they are cheering for they are not working together towards a common goal, whilst the football team is working on winning the match.
Another example could be the students in the tutorials for this course. They most likely do not know each other and have no common goal. While they might all have an individual interest in preparing themselves for the exam with the help of the tutorial, they are not working collectively towards it. However, after these students have been put into teams they now have a common goal which is the project. Ideally, the members would be aware of each other's weaknesses and work to solve the problem together.

The difference between a team and a group is that within groups people do not share the same visions/goals/outcomes for the output whereas in teams the members do. 
Further, within groups, the members are loosely connected while in teams they are strongly connected. 

An example for a group is our tutor group (a loosely connected group of a number of people with not particularly the same outcomes or goals in mind), whereas an example for a team is e.g. in sport a soccer team, with a shared activity and a shared common goal (winning the soccer game).

In groups people are connected by a certain relationship but they mostly act on their own and don’t have a common goal. For teams however every participant works towards a common goal and they’re connected closely by that goal. For a successful outcome of that goal they need to work together closely.
For example there’s a wide group of people that use cars as means of transport but the people developing the cars have to be in a team because they’re working closely to achieve the best possible outcome of the product.
Another example would be a group of people that likes watching a certain film that is mostly connected rather loosely but the team producing that film has to be connected closely to work efficiently on that product because it’s a process which every member is important for.

Gruppe: Eine Gruppe ist eine Ansammlung von Menschen, welche gemeinsame Interessen, wie z.B. eine gute und spassige Zeit in der Uni zu haben, hat. Sie sind jedoch keinesfalls an einem gemeinsamen Ziel, noch dessen Erreichen orientiert. Dies ist eine blosse Ansammlung zur emotionalen Befriedigung. 
Team: Ein Team ist eine Ansammlung von Menschen, welche ein gemeinsames Ziel vor Augen haben, welches sie gemeinsam erreichen wollen. Sie sind leistungsorientiert. Hier sind Machtverhältnisse schon klar abgeklärt und diese Menschen sind sich bewusst dass sie gemeinsam mehr und alles besser schaffen als alleine. Sie verlassen sich aufeinander und können  nun, nach der Teambuildingphase, gut und effektiv zusammenarbeiten ohne unnötige Diskusionen zu führen, die sie auf ihrem gemeinsamen Weg aufhalten würden.

Group: a number of people that have some relationship to one another
• Participants are loosely connected
• Do not focus on specific outcomes or a common purpose
• Every individual works on his own

Team: any group of people involved in the same activity with a common goal,
especially referring to sports and work
• Participants are strongly connected
• Focus on a specific outcome, requires coordination of tasks and activities
• Members need to work together


Examples:
Team: 
1. A team in a competitive team sport like soccer, every player knows his and the position of the others, they need to work closely together in order the reach their goal and beat the other team.
Or In Student organisations like tum boring, tum hyperloop or tu fast, the members need to be coordinated, focused and co-work in order to reach their goal in a specified schedule. 

Groups:
assembly line worker of a company: everyone focuses on his own work, just need to do "their" job

A group is a collection of people that do not necessarily share the same objectives. A group of people will not necessarily work together to attain an objective. For example, a group of football supporters in a stadium will cheer for opposing teams to respectively encourage or bother the teams that they support or root against. Hence, they will not work in collaboration to attain a common goal.


A team is a collection of people with a common goal who work in collaboration to attain their objective. A basketball team would be an example of a team that plays together and develops a strategy to win the game (therefore, attaining their common goal).

A group is a collection of people, with no purpose and everyone acts on his own.
Like a school class on a test, where everyone has their own goal.
A team is a group, but all the participants have a common goal. They work together and focus on a specific outcome. 
Like an F1 team, where everyone has to work together to achieve a common goal: winning.

Group describes only a collection of people that somehow relate to another; they do not have to have any cooperation with each other. Look at an multiplayer online game for example. If they match up with another, randomly, they are just a group and they might share goals, they might also just not.
A team on the other hand is a group with a unified purpose and goal. They try to help each other to achieve their goal together and they usually fill different roles. In sports for example most groups can also be seen as a team, since they usually try to achieve a goal (sometimes quite literally), and they specialize in positions or role.

A group is said to exist when its members are connected in some way, for example in a tutor group. The connection comes from the same assignment and the goal of learning something. However, here each member works for himself, without working together on a common goal.
A team is a group of people who pursue a shared goal. Here, the connection through the mutual target is much stronger, and in order to achieve it, you have to work together. Ideally, in a graded seminar you work together as a team, tasks are distributed but everyone contributes a part to the good grade, because one alone can not lift the workload.

A group of people just exist "next" to each other and are connected by an attribute. While a Team work on the same goal through a shared activity. 

A school class would be categorized as an group by this definition. An example of a team would be a club e.g. Drama Club.

Groups are loosely related persons, Teams are united with the same goal and vision and work together.
e.g.

1) Employees of the university form a group because they all have a contract with the university. In this context a team could be a professorship (or within a professorship) with a few students or doctoral candidates that work together on a specific research question. The team would collaborate closely, share ideas and resources which they would not share with other employees of the uni.

2) Police detectives that investigate on a specific case (e.g. a murder case) would form a team and collaborate closely and even share insider knowledge which is not available to the public or other police men. However they still form a group with the police men in their department to which they are only loosely related.

If 11 football players enter a match, it does not long not mean that they are a team. If they do not follow the common goal of winning the match, even individual skill won't carry. If they compete as a team, they are able to bring together their individual strengths, and use these as a "combined" power. Another example may be a simple dev-team: You can always just give others tasks, but like this, they also work individually - whereas, as a team effort, everyone works on the same, or at least a similar, level, and good communication leads to strong coordination, resulting in a better outcome.

A team is a group of people that are united by a common goal. These people have a strong connection and work together toward their goal.

For example, all the students participating in this lecture form a group.  Every individual works on his own.
When students decide to participate in the team projects, they get together to form teams and work towards their common goal : to experience agile software engineering and get a good score.

Another example:
All the TUM students that are interested in extracurricular activities form a group, and then everyone picks a team based on their interests, like the TUM-Hyperloop-Team.

The differences between groups and teams are: 
1. The relationships between the participants (group with loose connections and team with strong connections).
2. The work states (each person in the group work individually and each person in teamwork together).
3. The outcome (the group does not focus on a specific outcome and team members usually have the same goal).

A group describes a number of people that have some relationship to one another.
The members are loosely connected and do not focus on a special outcome.
Additionally, everyone works on his own.
An example would be a school class.
As there is a simple relationship and everbody in the class accounts for his own failures.
FC Bayern is a team.
As all of the players in the team work together to accomplish their common goal(s).

A group, includes people that are found in the same environment, having some kind of connection with each other(such as a common purpose to be there), but they do not work towards this purpose by helping nor by counting on one another. 
Example: A group of people watching a live performance, such as a concert. 

On the other hand, a team does include people that are supportive, exchange ideas and work together as one to fulfill a certain goal/purpose in the best and most effective way possible. 
For example, a team of volleyball players requires  them to cooperate, believe in each others skills and work together to win the game.
short answer

A group is a collection of people who are not specifically connected to each other and don't act together for a common goal.
A team on the other hand is a collection of people, who are trying to reach a goal together through bonding and tactical distribution of tasks.

A Group is a number of people, that for most of the time because of a outside reason have to work together for maybe once.
Example a gondola in the alps is halted and the group inside doesn't know each other and have to stay calm.

A team is a number of people .

Groups are only loosely connected, but people part of a group have a relationship in common. Everyone works on their own. Example: Attending a language course, people participating all learn the same language (common relationship), but everyone solves assignments on their own. 

Teams however are closely connected, work towards a common goal and work together. Example: Workers building houses. They work together to create the full result, a house in this case, and everyone can count on the others doing their work correctly.

A group is build by a number of people who by some means can be connected to each other due to factors like age, location, profession etc but do not necessarily have the same goal or a strong relationship to each other and therefore do not (need to) work together on something. For example alle the employees of a company can be described as a group even though not all of them work at the same thing or even have to know each other.
A team is a group of people that are strongly connected and have to work, plan and communicate together to reach a commen goal. The first example which came to my mind is when solving an Exitroom together with friends but in a larger scale all sorts of sport groups like baseball, volleyball... and work groups have to function as a team. 
It can be noticed that groups can be or usually are larger than teams since communication tends to get very difficult with a high number of people.

Gruppe:
Eine Gruppe ist eine Ansammlung von Menschen, welche durch Zufall oder durch Bekanntschaft 
zusammenkommen. Sie fokussieren kein gemeinsam zu erreichendes Ziel und arbeiten jeder für sich.

Beispiel:
-> Eine Gruppe von Studenten, sie kennen sich durch studieren im gleichen Studiengang, sie treffen sich nur auf dem Campus während der Vorlesungen, jeder arbeitet und lernt alleine.


Team:
Ein Team ist eine Gruppe, in welcher jeder einzelne die Stärken und Schwächen der anderen kennt und diese durch gezielte Arbeit ergänzt, um ein gemeinsames Ziel zu erreichen.

Beispiel:
-> Ein Entwicklerteam entwickelt ein Spiel, sie teilen die Arbeit untereinander auf, da jeder von ihnen in einem Bereich besonders gut ist. Sie arbeiten auf die Vollendung des Spieles gemeinsam hin, kommunizieren miteinander über Fortschritte und Probleme.

A group is only a collection of people that are not or only slightly connected together and every person in a group works for his own, e.g. a school class is a typical example for a group. Whereas in a school class the students can form a team for working towards a common goal like for example the presentation of a historical topic. Therefore the team members have to focus on the similar outcome and need to work together because every team member has to do his part (coordination of tasks). Contrary to the class (group) they are connected in the sense that they have to work together on a project.

A group is a set of people who are connected in any way, but in which everyone has their own goals. In a team, on the other hand, the members pursue these same goals and work together professionally to achieve them. 

An example of a group is a clique, in which everyone is friends and there for each other, but they all pursue different goals (e.g. professionally). In order to really achieve a goal, each member of a team is needed, because it is not friendship, but professionalism and the standardization of goals that leads to the achievement of precisely these goals.

Another example is a group of students in the lecture hall. They are united by a common interest in the subject, but they do not form a team because each works for his or her own goals.

In general, groups consist out of a certain number of individuals, whose main purpose is not to achieve a defined common goal. A great example for that is the usual friend group that doesn't follow a common goal or outcome, but rather connects individuals that follow their own goals and try to realize their own outcomes. Members of groups aren't strictly connected to each other because of that.
On the other side are teams. Contrary to groups, teams have a common goal and act to achieve a certain outcome. The formation and the activity of the team is thus mainly based in reaching a defined goal, whereby all members contribute to it, since they do not act as individually as members of groups. A great example for that is a basketball team, where every player has his or her role and was introduced to the team to win a championship or help the franchise in general.

The difference between a group and a team is easily explained. For example in a Formula 1 team the people have a common goal: they want to win the world championship. In order to achieve this they need to work together and collaborate. They work, travel and live together for a large part of the year. So they have a strong connection with each other and teamplay is vastly important. In a group, however, I will take the visitors of a bar as an example, there isn't a strong connection. The crowd in the bar is connected through the location. Also, they do not have a common goal. Some might be here to drink a few beers while other might want to meet new people. In order to achieve their goals they all work for themselves and do not cooperate.

The skills, knowledge, perspectives and strengths of each member in the team are identified specifically and utilized properly. On the other hand, a group is defined as a number of individuals forming a unit for a certain reason or cause, group members usually have members sharing similar kind of knowledge and skills in a certain field such as marketing. For eg. a cancer awareness group. For example, we have a cricket team of 11 players which have a goal to win the match and each player has different task areas such as batting, bowling or fielding, and we won't call it a cricket group because in a group players can focus on their own performance than winning a game for their side – or we have a special interest group, not a special interest team. To be precise team works together and shares in the outcome, while a group is more independent of each other.

The differences between groups and teams boil down to a few core aspects.

A team is a collective of people who work together to achieve a common cause, and share their work/efforts to achieve more coordination and efficiency.

A group on the other hand is just a loose collection of people who do not work together and likely just happen to be in the same place for some specific reason. There is likely no intimacy between members and also no cooperation.

Examples for a team would be f.e. in sports. The 11 players on a football team need to coordinate and execute their actions in ways to benefit the other teammates and achieve a victory as a whole team

A group f.e. would be the attendants at a concert. All of them are there for similar reasons, but many do not know each other/interact and everyone follows their own purpose

A group can refer to any collection of people, while a team consists of a concrete set of members who work together towards a common goal.

For instance, when randomly picking individuals out of a crowd you find wandering through the city, you end up with a group of people.
Meanwhile, when you give a group of people a problem statement or a concrete task for them to work on collaboratively and cooperatively, such as to complete a software package, they may come together and form a team to do so.

-A group represents a number of people with weak connections between each other who don't share the same goal and don't work together as a unity but rather every one works on their own. An example for a group would be a group of students who are attending a certain lecture but aren't involved together in a project or a group work. They're not strongly connected and each student is learning and solving exercises on their own.

- A team is group of individuals who trust each other and can communicate well and work in coordination to achieve a shared goal. An example would be a software development team who are assembled together to produce a solution for a certain problem and coordinate their tasks and activities in order to achieve that.

A group is a number of people that are not strongly related and they do not work together for a common goal, for example if there were an gaming station and everyone is just playing on their own, then they are a group of players. Take another example, when a few peole are on a lake rowing on their own, then they are also a group.

A Team is a group of people who works together for a common goal, it envolves collaboration and communication in some sort of way, take the examples from above, if the players are playing together in unision to beat a boss(which is a common enemy), then they are a team, if the boat rowers are on one large dragon boat where everyone hast to collaborate to row, then they are also a team.

a Team is a group a people that are doing the same activity  together and  strongly related to each other by a bound which is the achievement of specific goal or aim (e.g. a Team that develops a video game(which requires that the tasks that should be done by each  member of the team should be coordinated ) or a Sport team especially football or basketball team). In the other side a group is  a number of people that are no strongly connected and don't share a common goal which means everyone works on his own and does like his wants and for example a group of pupils  at the school canteen (maybe a poor example ;D)

A "group" is a group of people who have recently met and not yet established trust beteween the members like a team has. For example in a team everybody knows the excact soft and hard sklills of one another and so can assingne the work smouther. A second difference is that in a Team everyone needs to work together inorder to achieve the goals they have, in a group everyone can work on his/her own. For excample a Team is able to resolve difficult problems with multible aspekts and is doing so in a relativ fast paste, while a group can only be assigned light work like doing repetativ work with low difficulty.

A group is a collection of people that have a loose relationship to each other, such as being in a crowd. While they are, on purpose or perchance gathered, they do not work towards the same goal or have the same purpose in mind. They are each to their own devices. 

For example, take a group of students taking a lecture. Some may be friends, but most are strangers, their common relationship is merely attending the same lecture. Some came to learn, others to listen in and others even maybe to just accompanied a friend, they each have a different goal in mind, focusing on different things, with different purposes for being present. They do not as a whole work together, but rather individually make sense/take notes/listen in on the topic presented.

On the other hand, a team is a group of people working closely together towards a common goal. They coordinate with each other to achieve a specific outcome. They help each other out to achieve something greater which they would not be able to do alone. Together everyone achieves more.

For example, take a scrum team. Generally consisting of a product owner, scrum master and developers. They each know each other and should be on friendly terms to productively collaborate. They communicate frequently allowing for close coordination of their respective tasks. They share a common goal and closely work together to achieve it.

Differences: 

The main difference between groups and teams is the ability to work efficiently together. This contains aspects like the connection between the people and the focus on the same goal/outcome. 

Examples:

1) If we have a group that is not well connected and one person has a problem that affects the other members of the group as well, but the person doesn't communicate this issue completely or too late, this could cause a lot of other problems like a bad compatibility in the project. In a team such issues can be avoided by good communication between the team members. 

2)  If the group members have not the same goal, instead they want their own idea to be realized, then they might not help the other group members with a different idea. As a result with have different approaches which lead to nothing. A team avoids this situation by using "Storming"(stage 2) to achieve a situation where all team members have the same expectation of the project, so they can work efficiently together on one approach, which has been assessed as the best approach for all.

Eine Gruppe besteht aus Menschen, die wenig Beziehung zueinander haben, aber an einem Ort oder einer Tätigkeit, jeder für sich, aktiv sind. Dabei können Tätigkeiten ähnlich sein, jedoch wird kein gemeinsames Ziel oder Produkt erarbeitet. 
Beispiel: In einer Schulklasse haben die Schüler jeweils das Ziel zu bestehen, aber jeder für sich arbeitet daran es zu erreichen ohne Zusammenarbeit mit anderen.

Ein Team ist eine meist bewusst gewählte und oft kleinerer Gruppe an Menschen, die Inhaltlich an einem Projekt/Produkt arbeiten. Die Bindung der Menschen untereinander ist größer und sie müssen zusammenarbeiten um ihr gemeinsames Ziel erreichen zu können.
Beispiel: Eine Sportmannschaft sucht sich die besten Spieler aus, die viel gemeinsam trainieren mit dem Ziel zu gewinnen. Nur gemeinsam können sie ein Spiel spielen und somit gegen andere Mannschaften gewinnen.

A group is a number of people who don't quite work together, but rather on their own. They do not have strong relationships and they do not work towards a common goal. A team, on the other hand, work together towards a common goal and are in a good relationship and connection with each other. They coordinate their tasks and activities and might even use the scrum technique to communicate their progress.

An example for a team is a game development team (for example the art or programming department of a studio) that works together to program and release a game. In order for the game to be good and thus successful they have to work together, assign special fields of work to every team member, have good and productive relationships and cooperate with each other / coordinate their tasks, so that the game is released on time and the schedule is fulfilled. 

An example of a group, on the other hand, would be a dozen of people, who, for example, take a first aid course for their drivers license or are a school class. At the first aid course, the participants generally only know themselves for only the one day the course takes place, so they only have a loose relationship. They also only focus on achieving their own goal of getting their first aid course participation certificate, so they also do not work for a common goal, but everyone rather works for himself for his / her own certificate. (The only exception when they work together, is when they do the revival excercise, but even then the work is uncoordinated, because everyone has to do the same excercise and there is no coordination of tasks.)

Groups are people who have similarities and thereby some relationship to each other.  However, these relationships are loose and each individual focuses one themselves and does not work for a common purpose of the group. 
On the other hand are teams, which can be thought of as a subgroup of a group. In addition to sharing some relationships and similarities similar to groups, teams are strongly connected and work together to achieve a specific goal. This is done through coordination of tasks and activities.
One example would be a tennis club. In a tennis club, each player plays tennis and wants to win his/hers matches. Thereby the participants of a tennis club form a group. If now some players decide to jointly participate in tournaments together, for example by playing in a double, these players form a team. In this team they work together with the common goal of winning their matches in the tournament and coordinate their skills so they win most of their matches. 
Another example would be all participants in this Software Engineering course. All students have the similarity of taking this course. However, each students tries to maximize his/hers success in this course on his/hers own. Thereby all students form a group. If now some students in this course meet and come up with the idea of developing an app, they will form a team. In this team the students are more strongly connected and work towards the same goal of developing an awesome app. To achieve this, they need to allocate the subtasks to each team member.

Eine Gruppe ist eine Menschenmenge, die nicht unbedingt eine Beziehung zueinander haben oder sich überhaupt kennen. Ein Team ist eine Gruppe von Menschen, die sich gegenseitig vertauen und sich gegenseitig anregen um ein gewisses gemeinsames Ziel zu erreichen . In einem Fußballspiel, bei dem Bayern gegen DOrtmund spielt, sind alle Spieler, die im FCBayern sind ein Team, da sie zusammen das Zeil verfolgen, den Ball in das Tor vom Dortmund zu schießen und arbeiten gemeinsam. Wenn man eine Gruppe an Menschen beachtet, wobei die Hälfte aus dem Bayern Team sind und die andere aus Dortmund, so kann man diese nur als eine Gruppe von Menschen betrachten, da sie alle nicht gemeinsam irgenein Zeil verfolgen. Ein Team wäre außerdem ein Gruppe von Menschen, die gemeinsam versuchen, etwas zu entwickeln, wobei jeder Member seine eigenen talente mit sich bringt, sodass sie die Arbeit aufteilen und gemeinsam schlussendlich ein Produkt erstellen. Wäre in dieser Gruppe auch nur einer der Meinung, dass sie nichts machen wollen und das Produkt schlecht finden, dann ist diese Menschenmenge nur eine Gruppe und kein Team mehr.

Team must work together to reach its goal, for example, football team. Group is a number people who are loosely connected and don't need to work or even know each other, for example, a fun group of a football team.

People in a group although have connections to each other but do not neccessarily work together to achieve a common goal. On the contrary, people in a team are united by a common purpose and therefore have to work together in order to achieve it.

Group is some people who have same relationship with others.They know each other,but they do not work intensively for a same goal.People in a team work for the specific goal.They trust each other and everyone plays different role to make the best contributions for the goal.A excellent team has the ability to deal with different opinions,with argues,with frustration when losing.However,everybody has strong responsibility and feels shame for the idea that "Toll,ein anderer machts.”
For example,chinese football team is more like a group of people.They do not trust their teammates and always say something bad in the back.They are good at passing the buck to others when they lose the game.You can not see the strong desire to win because the guard will move in order to avoid being hit by the ball.
For instance,the team of Elon Musk is our model.They did what was assumed to be impossible.They send rockets the the universe by their own hand and brain.In the hardest time,in the biography of Elon Musk writes,most staff choose to stay even they have no salary.They still devote their time for the team because they trust each other and always believe that they can make achieve their goal!That is the way they achieved somthing impossible.

In a group, the participants are only loosely connected. Depending on the group, these connecting factors might be age, beliefs or similar factors, that lead to a rather loose relationship. Group members can usually identify with one another, but lack a purpose or real reason to really form strong bonds. Groups tend to have at least somewhat similar goals, but the goals vary from one group member to another, thus each person will work on their own to try to achieve it. 

As people in Teams work together with a common goal in mind, where different phases of this activity require close collaboration, much stronger bonds are formed, and a more strongly team spirit is created. With a shared goal, members also have to work together and communicate to achieve it in a timely manner.

A team has a specific common goal and the members support each other.

In a group of people there is no common goal.It's  just people together

Eine Gruppe is eine Ansammlung an Menschen, die über eine wage Verbingung miteinander im Zusammenhang stehen, jeder ist erstmal nur für sich da und arbeitet auch so, es besteht kaum Interessensüberlagerung und es wird sich auf keine fokusiert. So ist eine Schulklasse oft (vorallem am Anfang) nur eine Gruppe, man hilft sich erstmals kaum und ist nur verbunden über dieselbe Zahl+Buchstabe
Ein Team ist eine Ansammlung von Menschen die dasselbe Ziel erreichen wollen und dies auch zusammen machen wollen. Alle sind stark miteineander verbunden und koordinieren und planen als eine Einheit. So ist eine Referatsgruppe in der Schule meist ein Team, arbeiten werden aufgeteilt und man teilt(und ist dadurch verbunden) meist das Interesse am Thema oder zumindest an der guten Note des Referats.

Group is a collection of people, whereas a team is a group with specific common goal or interests. Team members have mutual support und responsibility for each other. The examples for groups would be a touristic group for a guide tour in the city or a group having common social background, such as ethnicity or religion (muslim people would form a group). The examples for team would be a start-up team running their own project or a National Team of Germany in the fencing competition.

Unterschied anhand zweier Beispiele - eines für ein Team - eines für eine Gruppe:

Ein FußballTEAM (z.B. des BvB) besteht aus verschiedenen Fußballern, welche ein gemeinsames Ziel 
verfolgen (z.b.: Meisterschaft, ChampionsLeague Sieger). Die einzelnen Spieler des jeweiligen Teams sind in Ihrem Auftreten und Agieren vereint - Mit anderen Worten sie fungieren als eine geschlossene Einheit. Um ihr gemeinsames Ziel zu erreichen, müssen die Spieler unter anderem zusammen trainieren und auf der Spielwiese als ein Team bzw. Mannschaft funktionieren - vereinfacht gesagt, sie spielen/arbeiten für ein gemeinsames spezifisches Ziel.

Eine ArbeitsGRUPPE besteht aus verschiedenen Menschen, welche das Ziel haben, ihren individuellen Arbeitsschritt auszuführen. Das Gesamtziel wird hierbei vernachlässigt. Lediglich bearbeitet jeder Member einer Gruppe seinen eigenen zugeteilten Arbeitsschritt - ugs. ausgedrückt: sie ziehen nicht an dem selben Strang. Jeder arbeitet in einer Arbeitsgruppe separat für sich alleine, für sein eigenes Ziel - man ist also mehr auf sich selbst fokussiert, anstatt sich mit den anderen Arbeitern einer Arbeitsgruppe zu beschäftigen und zusammenzuarbeiten - sind also nicht im engen Kontakt bzw. nicht eng mit dem Rest der Gruppe verbunden.

for me groups is like a large number of people, they stay in a group but have different tasks to do, for example everyone can do the thing differently about one Task and at the end they can make the answer together(maybe also have different answers),  but teams mean "always Together",that means we try to find a best solution. 

In order to find it, we stay together and share our opinions, so the relationship between people in Team is better as in a group. when we get to know each other better and of course we can let partners do what they are better at. A group is a collection of people who are loosely connected in some way but they are not organized or coordinated in any manner.

A team is a collection of people who work closely together towards a common goal.
They work together and are coordinated in order to more efficiently complete their task.

While both, a group and a team, consist of a number of people, in a team the participants are involved in the same activity (e.g. a soccer team) and follow a common goal. In a group the members work on their own and don't focus on a common purpose, even though they have some sort of relationship to one another (e.g. students in a lecture).

A group consists of people who mainly pursue their own goals. 
For example, some people doing individual sports like running. 
All of them are responsible for their own success, especially if they take part in a competition. 

In contrast, a team consists of people who are strongly connected, mainly by a common goal or task. They help and support each other, everyone has a specific role in the team. For example, some people doing team sports like handball. 

If the goal keeper of a handball-team decides to go home during a match, the whole team will fail, while it won't effect the other runners if one runner would stop running.

A group is a number of more or less familiar people who happen to know each other, whereas a team is a number of people who are united by a common goal in which each member knows how to play off of each others strengthes

Examples: 
(1)A regular highschool class can be considered a group, some pupils are connected, but in the end they don't work together in achieving a common goal, everyone just wants to pass on their own

(2)The highschool football team is a prime example for what makes a team: Every player is focused on the goal of winning the game and they are closely interconnected and know how to come together

A group is a gathering of people who have some kind of relationship to each other. A team is basically the same but the big difference between them is, that the members of a team are involved in the same activities and have a common goal. Furthermore, there is a stronger connection between the members of a team, because they need this connection in order to achieve their (common) goals.

example1:
a group of student who are listening to the Professor dont always have a connection to each other and they are able to reach their goals individually

example2:
A soccer team needs to stick together and work as a team in order to win their matches and become successfull. Individual work is not working in a team like this

Groups and teams are a collection of people. However, in a group each member strives for their own goals and people work for themselves, while in a team every member has the same goal working together hand in hand to archive it.


The members of a regulars table are a group whilst the waiters are working as a team.
Members of a regulars table don't have a shared goal. However, the waiters do have a common goal. To give the best service possible. A goal to which they work towards together hand in hand.

In open source development a group of people is working on a certain project. it is a group because they don't necessarily have the same goals, don’t even know each other and each one is responsible for his own work. An application from a company however is most likely developed by a team where all developers have a common goal and work together towards archiving that.

A team has an aligned perspective on the solutions to be provided, it is not robust to change, people trust each other and openly share new ideas. Whereas in groups the above-mentioned are not the case.

Group - When as a co-founder we hired 3 volunteers to join an already established real team, it became a group to work with from scratch. The newcomers were not only new to each other, but they were also new to the established team members. So, then as a group not a team, we went along all the stages of forming a performing team by transferring the idea and values of the startup, by engage in workflows, etc. However, before we could be called a team again, there was a clear lack of open communication, idea sharing and overall trust environment. 

Team - As a high school student I went to an IT company with other students from my school whom I barely knew. All together after several weeks we released an application. What shaped us as a team from a group were the initial ice breakers, continuous discussions about the problems we solve, continuous teamwork on product architecture and actual division of tasks by consensus. At the end, we all could answer almost any question about our project from that IT company or confidently refer to another team mate to handle the question.

Group members are belonging to a common set or category but they are loosely connected to each other and do not necessarily know each other. On the other hand, team members have common goals. they know each other and have strong connections and work together to achieve their goal. They need to be coordinated as well to divide and do the tasks. Every team is a group but not every group is a team. Teams are usually built in work or sports places where people have and follow common goals and activities.

They had a director on their team to coordinate the team. They had strong connections with each other to develop it.

Differences : Group is defined as number fo people that have some relationship to one another, they may or may not have a common goal, common activity.They are generally loosely connected i.e they do not influence each other's performance and the outcome, and every indvidual works on its own,
whereas a team is any group of people involved in same activity with a common goal. In a team people are strongly connected and work together i.e every indvidual has an influence on the other participant and on the outcome.

Example 1    : A football team, where people are strongly connected, have same goal i.e scoring the goal against the opponent and good coordination, communication are essential for a good overall performance and a successful outcome,
whereas  participants in a gym course are example of a group where people are related to each other through the course but they dont have affect on each others performance, they may or may not have a common goal(loosing weight, building muscle) and every indvidual works on its own, and coordination is not compulsory as it does not affect the overall performance of the group.

Example 2: Team of software developers, where people have same goal i.e building a specific product, needs to work together to avoid integration problems, thus they are strongly connected as well,
whereas a group of  colleagues, they may or may not have common goal(i.e some may be developers, some may be HRs), they work independent of each other i.e have no influence on each others outcome  and are loosely connected, as they belong to completely different departments.

The main differences are that people in a group just barely know each other while they are quite familiar with the characteristic traits of the other members in a team. Everyone works on their own in a group, in a team there is only one goal and it is to be achieved together. There is a good atmosphere and lots of trust in a team, people can rely on one another. The information exchange and feedback is immediate and constructive in a team as well.

When someone in a group feels betrayed or hurt, he might destroy the whole foundation of it.
In a team, everyone is accepted the way he is and there is a process for finding a suitable solution for every problem that might occur.

In a group, mostly the loud and extroverted members stand out and rule it. That can lead to the situation that some members could get the feeling that they cannot express their true opinion to others. A team adapts to all competences of every single member and takes advantage of them for the success of the project.

A group is just a collection of people that share some sort of relationship.
A team on the other hand is a group of people that shares a vision and has the same goals. They (should) also trust each other and get to know each other, while people in a group could be total strangers.

The difference between a group and a team lies firstly in the fact that a group is a set of persons associated together either by some outside factors or related to each other by some way. A group however doesn´t focus on a specific goal , each part of the group has his own vision and implementation. In a team the goals are common and so are the ways to achieve that goal because the members of the teams are strongly related by a united end product.

A group is just a conglomarate of people that are vaguely connected for example people standing at a train station might be considered a group, the are loosely connected as they may have the same goal (to catch the train), but have no real common purpose as every person is working on their own to achieve the goal. 
A team is a formation of people that are strongly connected as in a soccer team. They focus on winning the match and this can only be done by coordination of tasks and working together on their common goal.

A Group is a collection of people which is lossly related and do not nessarily have close ties whereas a team is a group of people who share a common goal and often times have close ties to each other.

A bunch of people that have some kind of assosiation (e.g. need to to something together) are called a group. The often time dont realy know eachother and are doing something in a limited timeframe. A team is a collection of people that work towards an main objective that they invision. They learn the strengths and weaknesses of each other and know how to communicate efficently between them. To be a team does take often a bit of time.

Let all members be defined as a node. A group will thus be defined as a loosely coupled set of nodes, which despite being slightly interrelated to one another, are independent to a higher degree. Whereas, a team is defined as a strongly coupled set of nodes sharing a collective and common goal, vision, or purpose, which they aim to achieve through coordinating and collaborating with one another.

Examples:
1. A bunch of students studying the same university course are referred to as a group. However, when a certain set of individuals from the group work together to develop an application or solve a problem, a team is formed.
2. In a company, people from various departments, acquaintance to one another, are together in a group. However, when specializing or narrowing down to a specific department or a microservice, the people work together as a team.

Angehörige einer Gruppen haben einen nur losen Zusammenhang und jedes Mitglied erfüllt eigenständige Aufgaben. Die Angehörigen der Gruppe verfolgen kein gemeinsames Ziel und haben keine gemeinsame Motivation.

Angehörige eines Teams gehen der gleichen Tätigkeit nach und haben ein gemeinsames Ziel. Zwischen den Teammitgliedern besteht eine starke Verbindung und die gemeinsame Zielsetzung erfordert ein Maß an Koordination der Aufgaben und Tätigkeiten. Die Zusammenarbeit der Gruppenmitglieder ist absolut notwendig. Ein Team ist nur so stark wie sein schwächstes Glied.

Eine Fußball-Mannschaft in der Bundesliga ist ein Team. Es gibt eine gemeinsame Zielsetzung (das Gewinnen eines Spiels) und jeder Spieler ist auch von den Leistungen der anderen Spielern abhängig, da er das Spiel sonst nicht gewinnen kann. Es gibt in jeder Mannschaft unterschiedliche Rollen und Aufgaben (Sturm, Verteidigung usw.), aber ohne die Koordination der Spieler (Spielplan, Spieltaktik, erprobte Improvisation) und effektiver Kooperation, ist die Mannschaft zum Scheitern verurteilt.

Die Mitglieder des Bundestags sind eine Gruppe. Das Mandat ist ihr Zusammenhang, aber außerhalb von Koalitionen und Fraktionen (und vermehrt auch innerhalb) sind die Ziele und Motivationen oft gegensätzlich. Jedes Mitglied ist nur dem eigenen gewissen verpflichtet und jedes Mitglied füllt sein Mandat eigenständig aus. Koordination und Kooperation sind nicht selbstverständlich und teilweise unvorstellbar. Ihre Aufgaben unterscheiden sich auch stark in den jeweiligen Ausschüssen in denen sie arbeiten.

In a group, people do their tasks (mostly) independently, often with little communication between the individuals. They are not necessarily strongly connected but rather aquatinted or disconnected.

In a Team on the other hand, people work strongly connected towards a common goal. They focus and organise themselves to achieve the best outcome. 

You can see this in the following two examples: 

In a class, students study alongside but do not work with each other. They hardly know their fellow students or do not know them at all. They work individually for their own goals.

But if the students have to team up to do a group project, they will connect with their partners and work together, chasing towards a good result. They have a common goal which can only be achieved with great communication and coordination.

A team has people who share a common goal with different skills whilst a group is formed of different individuals with mostly the same skills and thought process coming together to complete one assignment not goal or vision.
In a team all members share the responsibility in the outcome. On the other hand groups are only responsible for their individual performances.
An example of a team would be a football team or a leadership tam. An example of a group would be a trade union or a tutor group.

The two main differences between Groups and Teams are to be found in a common purpose which all team members work towards. In a Group however a common purpose is missing.
