similarities:
- both a collection of people
differences:
- team applies its human resources in a complementing way

example "rally driver and co-pilot":
John recently became Alex' co-pilot. John is used to read two corners ahead, since it worked best for his former pilot. Unfortunately Alex cannot deal with this reading rhythm. At this point they're a group. Now Alex asks John to read only one corner ahead and Alex adapts. At this point they became a team, since they complement each other. 

example "art project":
Alina and Paulina were assigned an art project. Naturally they distribute their human resources onto complementing tasks. Alina forwards questions to their teacher, and Paulina does the painting. Unfortunately Alina has some communication difficulties with the teacher and answers often remain unclear to her. Alina keeps this secret from Paulina. At this point they might be a team, since they complement their human resources to acchieve a shared goal, but they could improve performance by more team dynamics: Alina now tells Paulina about it. They decide that Paulina should be there as well when the teacher answers their questions. In order to preserve fair workloads Alina helps with the painting. At this point they became a better performing team.

A group is a bunch of people which only partly know each others skills. It's like you go hiking with a few people on a relative simple track. Those people I would consider a group. However if you want to climb a much more difficult mountain or something you really need people you can trust and who know their each individual skills to make it to the top.

The second example is that when you play sports in a team like baseball, you not only need to know each others skills, you also have be aware of their individual lack in certain skills to make up for them. In a group you may lack this knowledge and can't trust your teammates that they can properly support you in some areas. That's why you need a good working team instead of a group to play professional baseball.

1. The term "group" can be used to describe an amount of people located in on space and does not specify the nature of the dynamic inside it. Compared to that, "team" implies a cooperative group.
2. A group is not always working towards the same goal, while somehow shared motivation is a requirement for a team.

Group:
Multiple people loosely connected that just happen to belong together. Everyone works for his own interest and the group does not work as one machine.

Team: 
Multiple people that belong (is a common sense) together. They work as one machine on a common task.

The allied countries before the second world war were just a group of certain countries. During WWII they worked together to defeat Germany and they became a team.

When RB Leipzig bought all it new players after being financed, their players were just a group of people. It was the clubs and the trainers task to form them into a team that can compete in the Bundesliga - as they now are.

Eine Gruppe verfolgt im Gegensatz  zu einem Team kein gemeinsames Ziel, sondern ist nur eine Ansammlung von Personen, in der jeder die eigenen Ziele verfolgt.
Das Team arbeitet zusammen auf ein gemeinsames Ziel hin.

A group is a number of individuals who don't have a specific goal to work on together. Each person works on their own. Learning groups for example are 'just' groups, where the people might help each other with problems. In the end everyone focuses on learning on their own.

A team does have a common goal. They are involved in the same purpose and are working together in order to reach a goal or to create something new. Working on a bigger project for example a game requires teamwork, communication and coordination. In groups this point is not certainly nessecary for success.

A group is just a collection of people related to each other in some way, while a team shares a common goal in an activity they are involved in. One group of people would be the EIST students. They all participate in the lecture and all do the exercises but work for their own. In contrasts a team of an EIST team project works together and tries to achieve the common goal of getting as many points for all the participants. This requires communication and coordination among the team members.

The difference would be visible in how each person works in this certain group or team. Let's take sports as a very clear example. An NBA Team, consisting of professional players, will have the same goal, know each other's skills very well, which results in knowing each others' strengths and weaknesses, and have a very good chemistry in their team. That is what a team is like, complimenting each others' skills and weaknesses to get the best result with everything they have, and makes use of strategies and plans to score that basket. The equivalence of a group in this basketball analogy would be a pickup game between 2 group of players. They just want to play to have fun, they don't really know how they would work together, some players are maybe stronger, so they would most likely try to get the ball for himself, and have low motivation.

A second example would be a team in a workplace. I would give an example of my dad. He has good relationship with his colleagues, which are members of his work team. They are super ambitious, since they work in a recording company, they try to make the company the best in the country, they work so hard, sometimes they need to work on holidays, and they know, which people are the best suited for each job, and they can work together to achieve that goal. Even though my dad is technically the leader of the team, he wouldn't mind stepping down to let someone better than him to take lead and give the group directions, which will benefit the team's work. Some people in the office work sometimes as a group, but they have different goals to each other, and mostly benefit only themselves. Sometimes they would want a promotion, a higher pay, noticed by the boss. Don't get me wrong, they would work hard, but they judge their wins by their personal gain, not the collective success of the group.

A group is a collection of people who work separately for a common goal, while a team is a collection of people who work with each other, help each other for a common goal. Besides the people in a team are more connected with each other than the people in a group.
For example, there are two football teams, one of them is made up of a bunch of strangers, the other one is made up of a bunch of old friend. On the premise that they are at the same level, hundreds percent the group with old friends are going to win the game. Because they trust each other the connection between them are stronger than the connection between the strangers.
Another example,

Group means people who have a relationship with each other while team means a group whose members have the same goal. Everyone in the group has their own work and no one focuses on the common goal. In a team participants are strongly connected and focus on a specific outcome. Also, team members work together.

a team is a group of people between who there is a relation to achieve a common goal which requires coordination and working together. 
ex: a football team or a team of research 

while a group is simply a group of people between who there is a simple relation and every individual works on his own
ex: a group of friends or a family

An example of a group would be people who sit in a classroom and listen to the same lecture at a given time. Although they are in some kind of a relationship, they are not strongly connected, do not follow the same purpose, and work(listen to the lecture) on their own. On the other hand, an example of a team would be people who are working together on developing a smartphone application. In comparison to a group, a team would represent people who are strongly connected, and most importantly working together to achieve a common goal(developing an app which can be launched on the market).

The main difference between a team and a group is that a team makes each other strong and more efficient. They share the same goal. A group, however, only coordinates its efforts.
An example is the difference between a soccer team and a group of soccer players that play together for the first time. The soccer team works very well together the group however will probably lose against the team even though they might have the better players.
When a group of people becomes trapped, they turn into a team to free themselves. A group of people is always stronger as a team.

Group members may not know the strenghts and weaknesses of their fellow coworkers, however you would expect of a team that they make up for each others weaknesses and delegate the work considering each individual's strength.

A Group has no upper limit of members, but a team has. If a team gets to big, it's no longer possible to maintain the professional and personal relationships between its members. The team becomes a mere group.

A group differs from a team in the sense that groups do not have a common goal and can work individually. Teams need to collaborate to achieve their assigned outcome.

A group would be a group of high-school students working together to solve a common homework (but not a team homework) or study together for an exam.
A team would be the development team for a specific feature in a video-game, for example interactions between Mario and bricks in Mario Bros.

A group is a number of people connected in some way (location, age, interests, ...). The members of the group don't work together.

A team is a group with a common goal. The team members work together.


Examples:
The students in the EIST lecture are a group. All of them (maybe not everyone) are enrolled in the course, but they don't necessarily have the same goal and they don't work together (aside from the project teams).

The three students who are plagiarizing their homework are a team. They share a common goal - to pass the course with minimal effort - and they work together.

Team: meistens Menschen ohne eine Verbindung außer den Job, arbeiten auf ein gemeinsames Ziel hin und arbeiten meist stark zusammen.

Gruppe: meistens Menschen oder sich aus dem Freundeskreis oder ähnliches kennen; haben kein direktes Ziel vor Augen und arbeiten meist jeder für sich

a Group is people who come together but do not have a common goal that they work for and every person works by themselves.

a Team is a group of people that come together to strive and work together toward a common goal. The members of this team need to work together closely in order to achieve a specific outcome.

A group would be All the employees who work together in a company, but a team would be the employees who come together to master a certain task with a set goal. Such as different teams being formed to solve different problems in a supply chain. 

A group of people would be both teams coming together to play a match of football. But this group would be divided into two teams. Both these teams aim toward winning the game for themselves. Meaning each member of the respective teams have the common goal of winning, for which they need to work together with their team members harmoniously and pay attention to each other in order to do so.

- teams have common goals, whereas groups don't have to
- teams are well connected and synchronized, whereas groups are not necessarily

A team is a number of people who can work together and are also strongly connected. A team also focuses on specific outcomes, meaning it was created and serves a purpose.

In a group the people do not work together, but each individually, a strong connection between the group members or coordintion of different tasks is therfore not necessery. This also means that there is no common pupose in a group.

Example 1:
A group of people are standing on the sidewalk, there is no connection between them whatsoever. But a team of policemen are there to lead the traffic.

Example 2:
A team of electric engineers is working on a problem at work together. A group of people work at the same company with different fields, tasks, and problems.

group: Plenty of people that don't share much of a connection. Their reason to be together isn't their goal as every individual works on their own and expect different outcomes.
team: The reason that people are together and strongly connected is their common aim. They work together in order to achieve their goal and expect the same outcome.

Eine gewisse Anzahl an Personen, die eine Eigenschaft teilen (sie sind zum Beispiel im selben Ort, kommen aus dem selben Land..) sind eine Gruppe. Sie müssen nicht starke Beziehungen zu einander haben und jede(r) hat individuelle Ziele, Motivationen und eventuell Methodologien. Ein Team hingegen umfasst Personen die eine selbe Perspektive teilen: sie haben die selben (lang- und kurzfristigen) Ziele (in einem gewissen Kontext) und versuchen sie zu erreichen, indem sie lernen, zusammen zu arbeiten und so high-performance zu erzielen. Eine Gruppe kann also zu einem Team werden. Wenn ich zum Beispiel in einer Bank arbeite dann sind alle meiner Mitarbeiter eine Gruppe (jede(r) arbeitet an einem individuellen Projekt), aber die Personen mit denen ich an einem und demselben Projekt arbeite sind ein Team. Leute die aus dem selben Land kommen sind auch eine Gruppe, Fussball-spieler aus diesem Land sind aber ein Team, da sie alle das Ziel haben, im Spiel zu gewinnen.

Group is a number of people who are loosely connected where every individual works on its own. Team on the other hand is a group of people who are involved in the same activity and have to work together in order to achieve the goal. 
Example - Group: people waiting at the bus stop
Example - Team: football team

A group is a number of people who barely know each other. They are just focused on their own and not on a specific goal. A team is a strong connected group with the same goal and the interest in working together on a problem, to get a solution as a team.

Groups are a collection of people that are united by having somenthing in common. On the other hand, teams are  a group who have a common goal they are working together for.

Example of group: The students in a lecture.
Example of a team: A group of these students are working together to make the designated project as good a possible.

The difference between a team and a group can be pointed out with the involvement of the same activity with a common goal. That's why a team is a group but a group of people doesn't have to be a team.

A group consists of a quantity of people that share a small connection: e.g.: -same nationality
- go to the same university
- of the same gender
They don't work together, and therefore also not for a shared goal.

A team focuses on a shared goal and work together to achieving that goal. A team is a group, however a group doesn't necessarily form a team. Their bond is stronger and also they work together, while everyone in a group only works for themselves.

Groups consist of people who are connected with each other by a loose relationship and don´t have a purpose or an outcome as their goal. Also group memebers don't work together but everyone works on his own.
In contrast teams consist of people who are connected with each other by working on the same project with the same goal. Other than group memebers, team members have a common goal and outcome they want to achieve together. Therefore they coordinate themselves and work together.

A good example for a group is a bunch of friends who know themselves from some kind of activity but don't work on something together. This group of friends could become a team if they play in one soccer team and work together on winning titles and matches by coordinating the tasks of every player and play matches together.

The other way round a team of people working together on a certain project at work could become a group if they don#t work together and coordinate tasks anymore but everyone does whatever he thinks is right and doesn't coordinate with the others anymore. In this case a working team becomes a group which is not capable of doing what they should do because of the lack of coordination and teamwork.

Group is a number of people that have some relationship to one another, but they are still pretty independent.
For example: group of friends, tutor group of students

Team is is any group of people involved in the same activity with a common goal, so they really need to work together.
For example: football team, sales team

When two or more individuals are classed together either by the organization or out of social needs, it is known as a group. On the other hand, a team is the collection of people, who are linked together to achieve a common objective.
The group members do not share responsibility, but team members share the responsibility.
The group focuses on achieving the individual goals. Conversely, the team members focus on achieving the team goals.
In groups participants are loosely connected. In teams participants are strongly connected.
In addition focus on a specific outcome, requires coordination of tasks and activities. groups, for example, airline flight crew, they do their own part, and the division of labour is very clear. Teams, for example, management teams, their goal is very much the same, to make the company as profitable as possible

A team shares a target or main goal together, meaning that the members are aware of their target. Example 1: As a team, a task is divided in the way that the end project goal is reached. As a group, these people know that they share maybe some characteristics (interest or characteristics) in common, however, the end goal is not clear and some people are just there as observant or they have other end goals. 
Example 2: A couple at first is a group of people that are interacting and trying to live and overcome difficulties or experiences together. As time passes, they understand that the only way to get along is by becoming a team. Understanding their strengths and flaws, their relationship is no longer 50/50 but depends on their characteristics and the benefit of the team.

Both team and group refer to a collection of people. For a group, they tend to be loosely connected to each other, don’t have a specific goal / common purpose and work on their own. In contrast, teams have members that are working together in a coordinated fashion to achieve a specific outcome. Their participants are also more strongly connected.

Patients in the waiting room of a doctor are an example of a group. They are loosely connected, they “work” on their own and they don’t have the same goal (unless it’s described in very general terms).

People working together in a startup are in an ideal case part of a team. They share a common goal, are connected strongly through a formal recruiting process, and they achieve their goal through coordination.

While groups are simply an assortment of people who have loose relationships to each other and no specific task or goal they have to collaborate on, teams are a group of people with a strong connection, who coordinate their activities in order to work together to archieve a common goal.

Group: Tutor Group at TUM
- Participants work on the given exercises
- Participants do not necessarily collaborate to archieve understanding of the subjects, therefore they are only loosely connected to each other 

Team: Football Team
- Participants have a common goal: winning the match
- Participants have to work together to archieve the goal, by making a game plan, communicating and passing the ball to each other
- Participants have clear positions within the team, which means their relationsships between each other are also strongly defined based on said position.

A group is a constellation of people who have a relationship because there's something that they have in common. For example in a school class, where all the children go to the same classes and rooms and learn the same things. But they still keep individually because everyone of them has to write own exams and learn by himself. But if the school class is splitted in parts, because they have to do e.g. some presentations, the pupils become teams. Then all the teammembers work together on one project with the same goal and have to coordinate and split the work.

A group is a collective of people who have some relation to each other.
for Example a family is a group, and the population of a country is also a group

A team is a special kind of group, in which all persons in the team work together with a single goal in mind
for example an Army is a team, and a small company is also a team

1.example: Teams should have a common goal but groups do not have to. A few people who like football gathering together could be a group, but a football team could only be called as a team since they want to achieve a common goal - to win together in the name of their team.

2.example: It is necessary for teams to work or communicate with each other, however groups just gather together. A tour group is a group because they gather together for their own interest and they have no real business to do with other tourists. They can communicate with each other but they do not have to. However, a camera team which is on a tour doing a project together needs communication. They have to know what each other thinks and what each other prefers to show in the project. Otherwise the project would be in a mess.

A group is a number of people that have a loose connection but without having a common goal towards they work together.

A team on the other hand is a number of people that work towards a common goal in a coordinated way.
They therefore have a stronger conncetion in this regard.

For example a group is some guys that know each other in school and a team on the other hand could be any type of sportsteam or a development team.

Group is a number of people that have some relationship to one another. Team is any group of people involved in the same activity with a common goal, especially referring to sports and work.
Teams aim for a specific outcome, groups do not. 
Team members work together and group members tend to work on their own.

A group is a number of loosely connected people that share some kind of relationship to one another. They have no common goals and therefore work individually.
Example: people that are eating in a restaurant (no real interaction between them).

A team consists of people that are involved in the same work and have a common goal. They are strongly connected and need to work together.
Example: the staff that works in the restaurant (need to work together (waiter, cook, ...) in order to serve the customers).

A Group consists of a number of people whoare somewhat ralated to one another, however, they are loosely connected, working on their own, without a common purpose or specific results.

A Team instead is defined by any group which shares a common goal and involves its members into the same activity, requireing good coordination in their work to achieve a specific outcome while they work together in a strongly connected manner.

As examples we shall look at a group of game developers who each build their own games that might differ in every imaginable aspect, and a development team that works on a single game with combined efforts and strategy, achieving a well rounded final product.

A group is a collection of individuals that have some relationship to one another and a team is basically a group of people but with common interests or goals. For example, when people share an elevator ride they are a group, but if the elevator gets stuck they become a team because they share the common interest of getting out. Another key difference between a group and a team is that a group focuses on achieving individual goals but the team focuses in team goals. For example, in a university lecture a student doesn't really care if another student was able to understand a new concept presented in class, he only cares about understanding it himself. But if he gets a pair or a team assignment he is going to primarily focus on the overall result and will be certainly interested that the team members understand everything as well.

A group is a number of people (or rather things) associated by something. 
A Team is a group (of people) partaking in a certain activity and working together towards the same goal. 

For example, a group might be a number of people associated by their nationality: "a group of Argentinians", whereas a team would be the Argentinian football team, as by the definition there needs to be an activity (football), in which regard the team is working towards a shared goal together (to win the match).

A group is simply a collection of people, possibly working on the same project, but essentially each on their own. This can be for example a group of students in a tutorial.
A team on the other hand is a group of people working together on the same project, such as the teams we are going to be working in for the Team-Project in EIST.

Group: Some people who have loose relationships with each other. 
team: A group of people who have the same goal and work together to achieve it.

E.g. all student in a classroom of a lecture is a group. all people just stay in a room.
but in a team they must work to finish a homework and learn togther

A group is formed by a couple of loosly connected people that have some relation to each other but don't work together for a common goal. A team is a group of people with strong connections to each other, they focus on a common goal and to achive that, they need to work and coordinate their work together.
For example if some people regulary meet at a sports club doing athletics they may have a connection in training and so they form a group, but they will probaply only work on their own skills and no common progress. Whereas a (professional) soccer 'team' has to work together in order to win a game or any championship. They have to know each other, plan their tactics and play together - so they form a team.

Contrary to the individuals in a group, members of a team focus on a common goal working towards it. Group members, however, do not coordinate their efforts and thus work separately. Hence, one can say that team members are connected by a common aspiration which they can only achieve together whereas group members are connected solely by a common aspiration.

As an example, the students of the EIST class form a group. Each individual has the goal to pass this class which they can do well by themselves. However, once we form smaller groups for the project, we most likely will become a team. This is because it guarantees that we work together towards a common goal.

Another instance is sport teams. A soccer team needs to work closely together towards the goal of winning their match. If each player plays by themself, then they would not be a team but rather a group of people playing with a ball.

Group is a number of people who have some relationship to one another. Team refers to a group of people, who are involved in the same activity with a common goal.

Example1: Students in the same class is a group, because they are classmates to each other. However if they build up a soccerteam, they become a team, because they have a commen goal.

Example2: A tourist group is a group, because each indviduals in this group only needs to entertain him/herself. A volunteer group is a team, because each team member usually has a common goal.

Eine Gruppe und ein Team sind zwei verschiedene Dinge, gegensätzlich zur Annahme vieler, die Gruppe und Team als äquivalenten Begriff verwenden.
Eine Gruppe ist eine Zusammenführung von Leuten, die gleiche Gemeinsamkeiten aufweisen, wie z.B. ein gemeinsames Ziel oder ein gleiches Alter und eine lockere Bindung haben.
Die Ergebniserwartung und Beweggründe der Gruppenteilnehmer sind individuell und die Teilnehmer arbeiten selbstständig. Die Zusammenführung von Ergebnissen der Gruppenteilnehmer hilft aber bessere Resultate zu erzielen.
Im Gegensatz dazu haben Teammitglieder die selben Ambitionen und Ziele. Um ein Ergebnis gemeinsam erzielen ist Zusammenarbeit der Teammitglieder nötig und oftmals kann die Aufgabe nur gelöst werden, wenn man zusammenarbeitet und anderen vertraut.
Vorstellbar ist dies wie ein Puzzle: fehlt ein Puzzleteil, so ist das Puzzle nicht vollständig. Ebenso
fehlt bei der Teamarbeit auch ein Teil der Aufgabe, wenn einer nicht kooperiert oder mitmacht und die
Teamarbeit kann nicht immer zum Erfolg führen und tendiert zu scheitern.
Darüber hinaus hat man mit seinem Team eine tiefere Bindung und Beziehung als zu Gruppenmitgliedern und erreicht gemeinsam ein Ziel innerhalb eines bestimmten Zeitraumes. 
Ein Beispiel für eine Gruppe können z.B. Gruppen für Bundesjugendspiele sein. Die Teilnehmer werden hierbei nach Nachnamen eingeteilt. Die eigene Leistung steht im Vordergrund und man hat nicht zu jedem Mitglied eine tiefe Bindung, trotzdem kann ein gutes Gruppenergebnis bedeutend sein. 
Ein Team arbeitet hingegen zusammen, um ein gemeinsames Ergebnis erzielen zu können, z.B in einem Sportverein: Fußball. Nur wenn alle Spieler zusammenarbeiten, kann der Ball ins Tor befördert
werden, beziehungsweise ein Gegentor verhindert werden. Man kann nicht allein beides Spieler und Torwart
gleichzeitig sein. Fehlt die Teamfähigkeit kann dies zum häufigen Ballverlust und schließlich zum Verlieren führen.
